title: Fall for birding
caption: Fall for birding
desc: This common loon is spreading its wings in the Superior National Forest in Minnesota, near the border and along the northern bank of Lake Superior. As temperatures cool, the protected area becomes a birder's paradise as migrating flocks stop over on their flights south. Superior's 3.9 million acres and 2,000 lakes offer the right combination of water, woods, and wetlands to support over 155 species of birds, the most avian diversity found in any of U.S. national forest.
copyright: A common loon in Superior National Forest in Minnesota (© Jim Brandenburg/Minden Pictures)
